The Who's On First Spelunker Codebase

The code is broken up in to three parts:

go-whosonfirst-spelunker

This package defines a common interface (sometimes called a contract in other programming languages for how the Spelunker works. It defines the kinds of questions (methods) you can ask it and what the responses to those questions will look like. It does not actually implement any functionality.

go-whosonfirst-spelunker-{DATABASE}

These packages are implementations of the go-whosonfirst-spelunker interfaces. As a practical matter this tends to mean that it is the code that manages how the questions and answers defined in the spelunker inteface are stored and retrieved from a particular database engine. For example:

  • go-whosonfirst-spelunker-opensearch ...
  • go-whosonfirst-spelunker-sql ...

Each go-whosonfirst-spelunker-{DATABASE} provides codes and applications specific to its implementation. Each package imports the code from the go-whosonfirst-spelunker package and MAY import code from the go-whosonfirst-spelunker-httpd package, discussed below.

go-whosonfirst-spelunker-httpd
